title: Do You Know Your Energy Spend?
lead: As the annual budgeting process begins once more and the firm’s executives renew their demand to reduce operating expenses. More often than not, the solution lies in focusing on a cost that is rarely tracked in much detail: energy data.

title: Aussies are driving down livestock emissions with seaweed
lead: Red seaweed is claimed to reduce livestock methane emissions by more than 98%

title: India’s coal power shrinks for second year in a row
lead: A new study shows coal fell by 5% in 2020, caused by a drop in electricity demand and a rise in solar generation

title: NAO: Landfill tax rise by 700% triggered spike in fly-tipping
lead: National Audit Office has called on the HM Treasury to have a broader insight into the environmental impact of taxes

title: Nuclear Decommissioning Authority appoints new Sellafield chair
lead: Tony Meggs will take up the post for a three-year term on 3rd May 2021, replacing Lorraine Baldry who has led the Sellafield Board since May 2018

title: NatWest and Octopus Energy team up to make EV charging cheaper
lead: NatWest customers will be able to purchase EV charge-points at discounted rates

title: Solar PV to drive fourfold increase in Emirates’ renewable capacity by 2025
lead: UAE will reach 9GW of capacity by the end of 2025, new report estimates

title: Could AI hold the key to hydrogen storage challenges?
lead: A hydrogen plant in Orkney aims to show how AI can produce hydrogen in a more cost-efficient way

title: National Grid Gas fined £4m for handing over incomplete records
lead: The Health and Safety Executive found records on 769 buildings were missing, which meant gas risershad not been subject to condition surveys, inspection or routine maintenance for a number of years

title: UK to set up green finance research hubs in London and Leeds
lead: The research centres will help divert investment away from unsustainable activities such as deforestation and fossil fuels and towards low carbon sectors, ensuring climate and environment are at the heart of UK financial decision making
